channel.title: Microsoft Learn - in Intune
channel.description: The latest updates from Microsoft Learn in Intune

item.title: Known Issues for Endpoint Privilege Management with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure policies that define how Endpoint Privilege Management functions in your tenant, and behaviors when elevating files to run in administrative context.

item.title: Windows enrollment attestation - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Find out how the Device attestation status report can help you and learn to use the Attest device action to ensure your devices are secure and reliable.

item.title: Learn about using Intune to manage Microsoft Defender settings on devices that aren't enrolled with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Intune policy to manage Microsoft Defender security settings on devices that aren't enrolled with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up automated device enrollment (ADE) for iOS/iPadOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll corporate-owned iOS/iPadOS devices into Microsoft Intune with Apple Automated Device Enrollment (ADE).

item.title: Manage approved apps for Windows devices with App Control for Business policy and Managed Installers in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use App Control for Business policies and a managed installer to manage which apps are approved to run on Windows devices that you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Encrypt macOS devices with FileVault using Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune policy to configure and manage FileVault disk encryption on macOS devices, including Setup Assistant enforcement and comprehensive recovery key management.

item.title: View report details for encryption status of devices managed with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Microsoft Intune admin center to view reports for device encryption status across macOS FileVault and Windows BitLocker encrypted devices that you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use Microsoft Intune policies with tenant attached Configuration Manager devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use tenant attach to add Configuration Manager devices to Microsoft Intune and then deploy Intune policies to those devices.

item.title: Step 2. Create App Protection Policies for Microsoft Edge for Business - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 2. Create app protection policies for Microsoft Edge for Business across Windows, Android, and iOS platforms.

item.title: What's new in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Find out what's new in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Intune endpoint detection and response policy. - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure and deploy policies for devices you manage with endpoint security endpoint detection and response policy in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage antivirus settings with endpoint security policies in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure and deploy policies and use reports for devices you manage with endpoint security antivirus policy in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage firewall settings with endpoint security policies in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure and deploy policies for devices you manage with endpoint security firewall policy in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage account protection settings with endpoint security policies in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune endpoint security account protection policies to protect the identity and accounts of users.

item.title: Onboard and Configure Devices with Microsoft Defender for Endpoint via Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Integrate Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with Microsoft Intune, including connecting the products, onboarding devices, and assigning policies for compliance and risk level assessment.

item.title: Manage attack surface reduction settings with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure and deploy policies for devices you manage with endpoint security attack surface reduction policy settings in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Intune endpoint security disk encryption policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure and deploy Microsoft Intune endpoint security policy disk encryption policies for BitLocker and FileVault.

item.title: Manage endpoint security policies in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Security Administrators can use the Endpoint Security policies and profiles to focus on security configuration of devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up automated device enrollment (ADE) for macOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll corporate-owned Macs into Microsoft Intune with Apple Automated Device Enrollment (ADE).

item.title: Enable MDM automatic enrollment for Windows - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable Intune automatic enrollment for Windows devices joining or registering with your Microsoft Entra ID.

item.title: Upgrade the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway server software - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand how Microsoft Tunnel Gateway upgrades to new versions of the tunnel software for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Step 4. Create App Configuration Policies for Microsoft Edge for Business - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 4. Create app configuration policies for Microsoft Edge for Business across Windows, Android, and iOS platforms.

item.title: Step 1. Create Microsoft Entra Conditional Access with Microsoft Edge for Business - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 1. Create Microsoft Entra Conditional Access with Microsoft Edge for Business.

item.title: Step 3. Integrate Mobile Threat Defense for App Protection Policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 3. Integrate Mobile Threat Defense signals with Microsoft Edge for Business app protection policies in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Step 6. Deploy Microsoft Edge security baseline - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 6. Deploy the Microsoft Edge security baseline for rapid Windows security configuration.

item.title: Step 7. Understand Microsoft Edge for Business End User Experience for Windows - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 7. Understand Microsoft Edge for Business end user experience Windows.

item.title: Step 5. Create Settings Catalog policies for Microsoft Edge for Business - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 5. Create Settings Catalog policies for Microsoft Edge for Business on Windows and macOS.

item.title: Step 8. Troubleshoot Microsoft Edge for Business Data Security - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 8. Troubleshoot Microsoft Edge for Business corporate data security in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Secure Your Corporate Data in Intune with Microsoft Edge for Business - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Secure your corporate data in Microsoft Intune with Microsoft Edge for Business across all platforms.

item.title: In development - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes Microsoft Intune features that are in development.

item.title: Enroll Android Enterprise dedicated, fully managed, or corporate-owned work profile devices in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll Android Enterprise dedicated, fully managed, or corporate-owned work profile devices in Intune.

item.title: Overview of enrollment restrictions - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the enrollment restrictions available in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Troubleshoot auto-enrolling existing Configuration Manager devices in Intune - Intune
item.description: Helps you understand and troubleshoot issues when you set up co-management by taking Path 1 - Auto-enroll existing Configuration Manager-managed devices into Intune.

item.title: Bulk enrollment for Windows devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create a bulk enrollment package for Microsoft Intune

item.title: Manually Add the Windows 10 Company Portal App - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how your workforce can manually add the Windows 10 Company Portal app to their PC from the Microsoft Store.

item.title: Assign Apps to Groups in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to assign an Intune app to groups of users or devices using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Prepare Apps for Mobile Application Management With Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: The information in this article helps you decide when you should use the App wrapping tool and the App SDK to enable your custom line-of-business apps to use the mobile app management policies.

item.title: Discovered Apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand details about the detected apps that Intune found on a device.

item.title: Data Transfer Policy Exceptions for Apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create exceptions to the Intune App Protection Policy (APP) data transfer policy.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS direct enrollment - Apple Configurator-Setup Assistant - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Apple Configurator to enroll corporate-owned iOS/iPadOS devices with Setup Assistant.

item.title: Overview of Apple device enrollment in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Utilize Apple device enrollment to enroll and manage user-owned iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use direct enrollment for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Deploy and enroll macOS devices in Microsoft Intune using direct enrollment with Apple Configurator.

item.title: Manage Microsoft Edge on iOS and Android With Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune app protection and configuration policies with Microsoft Edge for iOS and Android to ensure corporate websites are always accessed with safeguards in place.

item.title: Use Remediations to Detect and Fix Support Issues - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about Remediations in Microsoft Intune, including what Remediations are and view any prerequisites and licensing requirements. Also, learn how to deploy built-in and custom remediation scripts, and learn how to monitor your scripts.

item.title: Encrypt Windows devices with BitLocker using Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune policy to manage BitLocker encryption on Windows devices, including silent encryption and Personal Data Encryption.

item.title: Manage devices with endpoint security in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Security Administrators can use the Endpoint Security node to view devices and manage them in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Settings you can manage with Intune Endpoint Protection profiles for Windows devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the available settings in Intune endpoint protection profiles for managed Windows devices.

item.title: Use the Vulnerability Remediation Agent to Manage Vulnerabilities
item.description: Learn how to use the Vulnerability Remediation Agent in Microsoft Intune to identify, prioritize, and remediate security vulnerabilities across your managed devices.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Remove Apps and Configuration - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how apps and configurations can be removed temporarily, then restored automatically or manually using the Remove apps and configuration device action with Intune.

item.title: Set up the Enrollment Status Page in the admin center copy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up a greeting page for users signing in and enrolling Windows devices copy.

item.title: Configure Platform SSO for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to configure Platform SSO and deploy the configuration to your macOS devices. Platform SSO enables single sign-on (SSO) using Microsoft Entra ID with the Secure Enclave, smart card, or password authentication methods. You create a settings catalog policy to configure the settings. This article is a step-by-step guide to configure Platform SSO for macOS devices using Intune.

item.title: Configure Update Policies for Apple Devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to configure software update policies for Apple devices using Apple's Declarative Device Management (DDM) model. Improve security, reduce user disruption, and ensure compliance with reliable, automated updates across your organization.

item.title: Get Started with the Device Offboarding Agent
item.description: Learn about the Device Offboarding Agent in Microsoft Intune, its prerequisites, how it works, and how to configure it.

item.title: Use Remote Help to Assist Users Authenticated by your Organization - Microsoft Intune
item.description: With the Remote Help app, provide remote assistance to authenticated users who also run the Remote Help app.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Collect Diagnostics - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to collect diagnostics with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Plan for Remote Help with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the requirements and capabilities of Remote Help with Microsoft Intune on Windows, macOS, and Android Enterprise.

item.title: Using Remote Help on Windows to Assist Authenticated Users - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Remote Help app to provide remote assistance to authenticated users who also run the Remote Help app, and to troubleshoot for frontline workers (FLW).

item.title: eSIM configuration of a download server - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about configuration of an eSIM Download Server from Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Work From Anywhere Report in Endpoint Analytics - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Discover how the Work from Anywhere report in Microsoft Intune endpoint analytics provides insights into remote productivity, device readiness, and user experience.

item.title: Vulnerability Remediation Agent Overview and Set Up
item.description: Learn about the Vulnerability Remediation Agent in Microsoft Intune, its prerequisites, how it works, and how to set it up. The agent uses AI to identify and prioritize vulnerability remediation based on Microsoft Defender Vulnerability Management data.

item.title: Change Review Agent Overview
item.description: Learn about the Change Review Agent in Microsoft Intune, its prerequisites, and how it works.

item.title: Enable eSIM data connections in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or use eSIM to get internet and data access using different data plans. In Intune, add or import activation codes, and then assign these activation codes using a configuration profile. You can also monitor the eSIM profiles and check the status of the eSIM-enabled devices.

item.title: Remote Device Actions â€“ Wipe, Lock, Locate, and More - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Discover how to use Microsoft Intune to remotely manage, wipe, lock, restart, and secure Android, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, Windows, and ChromeOS devices. Learn about available remote actions, prerequisites, and bulk actions for IT admins.

item.title: Learn about Policy Configuration Agent and set it up
item.description: Learn about the Policy Configuration Agent in Microsoft Intune, its prerequisites, how it works, and how to set it up. The agent is a generative AI feature that helps create Intune policies based on uploaded documents or benchmarks. The Policy Configuration Agent is a feature of Security Copilot in Intune.

item.title: Deploy Remote Help with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Follow the steps to deploy Remote Help with Microsoft Intune on Windows, macOS, and Android Enterprise.

item.title: Troubleshoot and monitor Remote Help for Microsoft Intune. - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the troubleshooting and monitoring information for Remote Help with Microsoft Intune to ensure healthy and successful deployment.

item.title: Enable Windows Backup for Organizations - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable Windows backup and restore in Intune for employees or students.

item.title: Enable autodiscovery of Intune enrollment server - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Simplify enrollment for users by enabling automatic discovery of the Intune enrollment server.

item.title: View enrollment reports - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Monitor and troubleshoot issues with enrollment restrictions and enrollment status page assignments.

item.title: Security Copilot Agents in Intune
item.description: Discover how Microsoft Security Copilot enhances Microsoft Intune through AI-powered security agents. Learn about available agents and explore their capabilities.

item.title: Use the Change Review Agent
item.description: Learn how to use the Change Review Agent in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Intune Enterprise Application Management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Enterprise App Management and the Enterprise App Catalog in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Assignment filter properties and operators reference - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Reference guide for device and app properties, operators, and rule syntax when creating assignment filters in Microsoft Intune. Includes examples and supported values.

item.title: Create device platform restrictions - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Restrict personally owned devices, and specific device platforms and OS versions from enrolling in Intune.

item.title: Configuration Policies for Intune App SDK Managed Apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to configure policies for Intune App SDK managed apps.

item.title: Assignment Filter Performance Tips for Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Optimize Microsoft Intune performance with assignment filters. Learn to use virtual groups, reuse groups, and apply filters effectively. Improve policy deployment speed with incremental group changes, and use assignment filters to include and exclude.

item.title: Intune Data Warehouse Collections - Microsoft Intune
item.description: The Intune Data Warehouse collections provide details related to the Data Warehouse API.

item.title: Platforms and policy types supported by assignment filters - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn which apps, compliance policies, and device configuration profiles and their platforms support assignment filters in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Assignment filter reports & troubleshooting - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use assignment filter reports to troubleshoot policies in Microsoft Intune. View filter evaluation results, resolve conflicts, and understand include vs. exclude modes.

item.title: Create assignment filters in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create assignment filters in Microsoft Intune to target policies based on device properties like OS version or manufacturer. Learn to create, update, and delete filters for managed devices and apps.

item.title: Devices - Intune Data Warehouse - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Reference article for the Devices category of entity collections in the Intune Data Warehouse API.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Wipe - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to wipe, or factory reset, devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use the Device Offboarding Agent
item.description: Learn how to use the Device Offboarding Agent in Microsoft Intune to identify and offboard devices that are no longer in use.

item.title: Manage Admin Tasks - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the centralized Admin tasks view in Microsoft Intune to manage tasks across capabilities.

item.title: Use Multi Admin Approval in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure Multi Admin Approval to protect your tenant against the use of compromised administrative accounts in Intune.

item.title: Zero Trust with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Intune contributes to a strong Zero Trust strategy and architecture.

item.title: Use Intune to remediate vulnerabilities found by Microsoft Defender for Endpoint - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune Security Tasks to manage threats and vulnerabilities identified by Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

item.title: Use the Policy Configuration Agent to create policies
item.description: Learn how to use the Policy Configuration Agent in Microsoft Intune to create policies. You can create policies on files you uploaded, natural language prompts, or industry baselines. The Policy Configuration Agent is a feature of Security Copilot in Intune.

item.title: Security Copilot in Intune features overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Security Copilot in Intune is an AI platform. It can help you create policies, get information about existing policies, and show more details on specific settings, including their impacts on users and devices. You can also use Copilot to troubleshoot device issues and query devices.

item.title: Microsoft Security Copilot agents in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Security Copilot agents in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Use EPM support approvals for file elevation requests with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Manage support approvals for elevation requests when you use Endpoint Privilege Management for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: iVerify Enterprise Mobile Threat Defense with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up iVerify Enterprise Mobile Security with Microsoft Intune to control mobile device access to your corporate resources.

item.title: Mobile Threat Defense with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) with your Mobile Threat Defense partner to protect access to company resources based on device risk.

item.title: App Protection Policies Overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Microsoft Intune app protection policies help protect your company data and prevent data loss.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS App Protection Policy Settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the iOS/iPadOS app protection policy (APP) settings for iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: Supported Microsoft Intune Apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article provides lists of support partner and Microsoft apps that are commonly used with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Understand Microsoft Intune Management Extension - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand Microsoft Intune management extension for Windows.

item.title: Android App Protection Policy Settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the app protection policy settings for Android devices.

item.title: Add Web Apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about adding web apps (client-server applications) to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Benefits of Intune App SDK - Microsoft Intune
item.description: The Intune App SDK is available for both the iOS and Android platforms, and enables mobile app management features with Microsoft Intune.
